summary: Excellent test coverage. 156 tests (94 TS + 62 Rust) all passing. Comprehensive coverage of stores, API layer, session lifecycle, parallelism, and crash recovery.
strengths: 156 tests total, all passing on first run
Agent store has 28 tests covering all operations including 5-agent parallelism
Rust git tests use real temp repos for authentic integration testing
Shared test-helpers.ts reduces boilerplate with factory functions
Bootstrap/crash recovery tested as extracted pure functions
Sidecar protocol roundtrip tests ensure Rust<->Node.js compatibility

issues.description: No direct UI/component tests (testing-library) â€” session actions tested at store level instead. Acceptable for MVP.
PTY management not unit-tested in Rust (requires real PTY which is hard to mock). Covered by integration testing instead.

recommendations: Add React Testing Library component tests in a future iteration
Consider adding E2E tests with Playwright for full agent lifecycle
